revision.text:
{{Infobox comedian | name = Frankie Pace | image = | imagesize = | caption = | pseudonym = | birth_date = | birth_name = | birth_place = [[Italy]] | medium = [[Stand-up comedy]], [[film]], [[television]], [[writing]], [[podcast]]ing | nationality = American | active = | genre = Stand-up comedy | subject = [[Observational comedy]], [[prop comedy]] | notable_work = | signature = | website = {{url|http://frankiepace.com}} | footnotes = }}
'''Frankie Pace''' is an American stand-up comedian and actor.<ref name=NYT>{{cite web|url=https://movies.nytimes.com/person/1070728/Frankie-Pace|title=Frankie Pace|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121103170100/https://movies.nytimes.com/person/1070728/Frankie-Pace|archivedate=November 3, 2012|work=[[The New York Times]]}}</ref><ref name=NF>{{cite web|work=[[Night Flight (TV series)|Night Flight]]|url=http://nightflight.com/stand-up-comedian-lovable-madman-frankie-pace-appears-on-night-flights-comedy-cuts/|title=Stand-up comedian & "lovable madman" Frankie Pace appeared on Night Flightâ€™s "Comedy Cuts"|author=Thomas, Bryan|date=January 30, 2018}}</ref><ref name=CJ>{{cite web|title=Laughter in the House: Frankie Pace at Princeton Catch|website=Centraljersey.com|author=Stoeckert, Anthony|date=September 24, 2015|url=http://www.centraljersey.com/time_off/laughter-in-the-house-frankie-pace-at-princeton-catch/article_07e2a486-62f1-11e5-94db-435e7535a972.html}}</ref>
Pace began his career in a [[Long Island]] [[comedy club]] called "The White House Inn" working alongside [[Eddie Murphy]], [[Rob Bartlett]], [[Jackie Martling]], [[Bob Nelson (comedian)|Bob Nelson]], Bob Woods, Richie Minnervini, [[Rosie O'Donnell]], Jim Myers and Don McHenry. After a few years he went to New York City where Rick Newman saw him and passed him as a regular at [[Catch a Rising Star (comedy clubs)|Catch a Rising Star]].
Pace performed on the April 14, 1984 episode of ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' which featured [[George McGovern]] as the host.<ref>{{cite web|date=April 16, 2016|url=https://www.bendouwsma.com/blog/2016/8/13/classic-snl-review-april-14-1984-george-mcgovern-madness|website=Bendouwsma.com|title=Classic SNL Review: April 14, 1984: George McGovern / Madness}}</ref> Producer Cynthia Friedman had Pace write and host his own television show for ''[[Night Flight (TV series)|Night Flight]]'' which appeared on the [[USA Network]] called "Rick Shaw's Takeout Theater".<ref name=NF/>
Pace later performed for on ''[[The Joan Rivers Show]]'' and acted on ''[[The Cosby Show]]'' and ''[[The Sopranos]]''.<ref name=NYT/> He also performed shows for [[Bill Boggs]] Comedy Tonight, [[Carolines on Broadway|Caroline's Comedy Hour]] and [[Comic Strip Live]] with [[John Mulrooney]].
When the comedy club scene slowed down, Pace revamped his act and looked for work in the [[Catskill Mountains]] which later led to corporate shows, casino shows and cruise ship performances.<ref name=CJ/> Pace later worked for [[Freddie Roman]]'s "Catskill's on Broadway".<ref name=CJ/>
In 1999 Pace appeared in the [[David Spade]] film ''[[Lost & Found (1999 film)|Lost & Found]]''.<ref>{{cite web|publisher=[[Rotten Tomatoes]]|url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/celebrity/frankie_pace|title=Frankie Pace}}</ref>
In 2012 Pace launched the [[podcast]] ''The Frankie Pace Show'' where he interviewed comedians and entertainers.<ref name=CJ/><ref>{{cite web|url=https://thefrankiepaceshow.wordpress.com|website=The Frankie Pace Show|title=The Frankie Pace Show}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|publisher=[[Facebook]]|url=https://www.facebook.com/TheFrankiePaceShowOnBabylonFm/|title=The Frankie Pace Show}}</ref>
In 2016 Pace did a comedy sketch parody of a [[Kiss (band)|Kiss]] [[Rocker (subculture)|rocker]] for ''Topical Waffle'' on ''[[The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon|The Tonight Show's]]'' [[YouTube]] channel.<ref>{{cite video|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iSiC_2QNFOc|publisher=[[YouTube]]|date=May 28, 2016|title=Frankie Pace Rocks}}</ref>
Pace also posts comedic [[doodle]]s entitled "Generations" on [[social media]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Doodles by Frankie Pace|url=https://www.facebook.com/doodlesbyfrankiepace|publisher=Facebook}}</ref>
